bcdf53f0-b8fd-4829-aed3-a635cf27d49f.description: The course objective is to provide an introduction to the basic academic, professional, and personal skills needed to be successful in college. The general course topics include motivating success; goal setting and time management; career exploration; social interaction and diversity; thinking and analysis; learning styles and strategies; study skills; beyond the classroom; health management; and financial management.
bcdf53f0-b8fd-4829-aed3-a635cf27d49f.name: College Success (SAYA-0040)(v.1)

a8c6cb98-dded-48a7-acd8-91a1015832dd.description: The course introduces the legal standards that managers must abide by while conducting business, and explores the legal framework designed to protect both consumers and businesses and outlines the legal environment in which businesses operate. Topics include nature and sources of law; litigation vs. alternative dispute resolution; torts; contracts; property law; intellectual property; employment law; criminal law and business; business organizations; and business regulation.
a8c6cb98-dded-48a7-acd8-91a1015832dd.name: BUS205: Business Law (SAYA-0024)

f333b21a-f78f-4a20-8f14-0c5bce68310c.description: The course studies the physical features of the Earth and its atmosphere, including landscape development, weather and climate, and geologic concepts, as well as the influence of human activity, including cultural, economic, and political activity on those physical features within a regional context. Ultimately, World Regional Geography is concerned with the physical and human characteristics that make the regions of our world distinctive.
f333b21a-f78f-4a20-8f14-0c5bce68310c.name: GEOG101: World Regional Geography (SAYA-0044)(v.1)

d79e8fe7-475a-4a54-93a7-66d8351b7ede.description: The course objective is to introduce logic and critical thinking by providing students with a set of tools and skills enabling them to identify and evaluate arguments. d79e8fe7-475a-4a54-93a7-66d8351b7ede.name: PHIL102: Critical Thinking (SAYA-0045)(v.1)

7260e721-decf-49c4-b3eb-4d4f90972182.description: The course provides an exploration of visual art forms and their cultural connections, including a brief study of art history, and in-depth studies of the elements, media, and methods used in creative thought and processes. Topics include defining art; process and training of who makes art; finding meaning in art; the elements and principles of visual language in art; artistic media; architecture; our world in art; myths, dreams, and spirituality in art; and art in the western world.
7260e721-decf-49c4-b3eb-4d4f90972182.name: ARTH101: Art Appreciation (SAYA-0036)(v.1)

a421df7f-bb1d-44f0-9135-b00692916b9d.description: The course objective is to introduce a range of basic sociological principles so you can develop your own sociological imagination. Students learn about the origins of sociology as a discipline, and some major sociological theories and research methods. Students also explore the topics of sex and gender, deviance, and racism. As we move through the course, try to develop your sociological imagination by relating the topics and theories you read about to your own life experiences.
a421df7f-bb1d-44f0-9135-b00692916b9d.name: Introduction to Sociology (SOC101)(v.4)

dfb79131-25c2-4660-af57-428848b7bbd1.description: The course objective is to understand and appreciate common biological topics in the study of the smallest units within biology: molecules and cells. Molecular and cellular biology is a dynamic field. There are thousands of opportunities within the medical, pharmaceutical, agricultural, and industrial fields (just to name a few) for a person with a concentrated knowledge of molecular and cellular processes. This course will give you a general introduction to these topics.
dfb79131-25c2-4660-af57-428848b7bbd1.name: BIO101: Introduction to Molecular and Cellular Biology (v.2)

96800a00-4df0-496a-a6a1-66542290681f.description: The course objective is to illustrate how management evolves as firms grow in size. It is based upon the idea that the essential purpose of a business is to produce products and services in order to meet the needs and wants of the marketplace. A manager marshals an organization's resources (its people, finances, facilities, and equipment) toward this fundamental goal.
96800a00-4df0-496a-a6a1-66542290681f.name: BUS208: Principles of Management (v.2)

The course implements a top-down approach to teach students the details about each layer and the relevant protocols used in computer networks.
ae1740fa-3bce-4e6d-a110-bf35f5ef3f5f.name: Computer Communications and Networks (CS402) v2

b1b8d89c-e71e-4101-ac33-4c0e601e5f26.description: The course objective is to introduce fundamental programming concepts by way of the Python 3 programming language. Python 3 is a high-level interpreted language that has many benefits, including easy-to-read and easy-to-write syntax and powerful libraries that provide additional functionality. Even though Python 3 is a great programming language for beginners, it is also used extensively for practical applications in engineering and data science.
b1b8d89c-e71e-4101-ac33-4c0e601e5f26.name: CS105: Introduction to Python (v.1)

Topics include systems of linear equations and inequalities, quadratic equations, exponential and logarithmic functions, and operations with rational expressions.
4686f1d2-95f9-4cbf-9dba-8b7acd54203b.name: MA001: College Algebra (v.4)

187303ed-1c39-4bd8-b0c8-5bc02d138404.description: The course objective is to survey the development and application of moral reasoning skills to contemporary social and political issues. Topics include philosophical investigations of justice, the value of human life, the moral standing of the free market, fundamental human rights, and the conditions for a moral community.
187303ed-1c39-4bd8-b0c8-5bc02d138404.name: PHIL103: Moral and Political Philosophy (SAYA-0011)

0782f810-862e-470e-a6a7-231da7df5665.description: The course objective is to provide students with a basic understanding of the principles of microeconomics. At its core, the study of economics deals with the choices and decisions that have to be made in order to manage scarce resources available to us. Microeconomics is the branch of economics that pertains to decisions made at the individual level, i.e., by individual consumers or individual firms after evaluating resources, costs, and tradeoffs.
0782f810-862e-470e-a6a7-231da7df5665.name: Principles of Microeconomics (ECON101) v1

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment are quizzes, examinations, and review exercises with a minimum passing score of 70 percent on the final exam.
This course is self-paced. The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and computer-based training.

8bbf638a-a342-412e-ba3d-8ce16fc702e9.description: The course objective is to examine business ethics from a variety of perspectives. The course will address ethical issues and dilemmas as well as ethical decision-making. The student will also be exposed to Corporate Social Responsibility as well as the impact of ethics on functional business areas
8bbf638a-a342-412e-ba3d-8ce16fc702e9.name: BUS200: Business Ethics (v.1)

3764ae6d-0746-4154-9d9a-29742aea61f9.description: The course introduces students to the concept of environmental ethics - a philosophy that extends the ethical concepts traditionally applied to human behavior to address the entire natural world. This course outlines the history of environmental ethic and environmental justice, and explores how our views about the natural world have changed over time, including major environmental laws that support the environmental movement and how ethics and morals help to shape environmental regulations.
3764ae6d-0746-4154-9d9a-29742aea61f9.name: Environmental Ethics, Justice, and World Views (ENVS203) v1

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment are quizzes and examinations with a minimum passing score of 70 percent on the final exam.

5f083722-65f0-453e-a182-2cd77f38863a.description: The course objective is to study the physics of motion from the ground up - learning the basic principles of physical laws and their application to the behavior of objects. Classical mechanics studies statics, kinematics (motion), dynamics (forces), energy, and momentum developed prior to the 1900 from the physics of Galileo Galilei and Isaac Newton.
5f083722-65f0-453e-a182-2cd77f38863a.name: PHYS101: Introduction to Mechanics (v.2)

d9ffcf9c-0749-48a0-bddc-0f6478be3ce9.description: The course objective is to introduce students to the principles of macroeconomics. Macroeconomics is the study of how a country's economy works while trying to discern among good, better, and best choices for improving and/or maintaining a nation's standard of living and level of economic and societal well-being. The course focuses on public policies helping and hindering the achievement of intended outcomes, such as reducing unemployment or increasing trade.
d9ffcf9c-0749-48a0-bddc-0f6478be3ce9.name: ECON102: Principles of Macroeconomics (SAYA-0006)

c8068211-9dc6-474a-99bf-acc1df47a4c0.description: The course objective is to examine the various components of business information systems, with particular emphasis on the means by which information is transmitted, the software that displays the information, and the systems that manage the data that businesses use every day.
c8068211-9dc6-474a-99bf-acc1df47a4c0.name: Management Information Systems (BUS206) v1

7722e1bc-cb9e-469a-a2d0-12f87bdaf445.description: The course provides an examination of waves and oscillations in extended objects; sources and laws that govern static electricity and magnetism; Maxwell's equations; optics; and Einstein's theory of special relativity. Topics include selected topics in vector calculus and differential equations; mechanical vibrations and waves in extended objects; electrostatics; electronic circuit theory; magnetism; electromagnetic induction; Maxwell's equations; optics; and special relativity.
7722e1bc-cb9e-469a-a2d0-12f87bdaf445.name: PHYS102: Introduction to Electromagnetism (SAYA-0030)

7038201e-1ea8-48a5-b61f-2fe3006f3831.description: The course objective is to survey the basic principles, terminology, and methods of political science. Students gain mastery of course concepts for the purpose of enabling them to think deeply about political life and understand issues in the context of contemporary politics.
7038201e-1ea8-48a5-b61f-2fe3006f3831.name: POLSC101: Introduction to Political Science (SAYA-0012)

7661f9f1-27b0-42a9-8db0-454a3e6d9e1b.description: The course objective is to examine how companies manage processes to produce the products or services required by their customers. The general course topics include operations management and overview; operations strategy; product design and process selection; quality management; supply chain management (SCM); just-in-time and lean systems; capacity planning and facility layout; work systems design; and inventory.
7661f9f1-27b0-42a9-8db0-454a3e6d9e1b.name: BUS300: Operations Management (SAYA-0038)(v.1)

e4226e2e-e963-47fd-942d-f0da38b320d4.description: The course objective is to introduce learners to entrepreneurship and business planning. This course is geared towards both the eclectic mix of individuals planning to develop and launch their own businesses as well as those with established small business ventures that they would like to expand. Topics include: history of small business, identifying successful entrepreneur's characteristics, basic business skills, how to write a business plan, launch a new venture, and more.
e4226e2e-e963-47fd-942d-f0da38b320d4.name: BUS305: Small Business Management (v.1)

By the end of the course, students will have a solid understanding of Java and C++ programming, and be familiar with the major issues that programmers routinely address in a professional setting.
efdc60b5-2f0c-49b6-9e62-6eaba6a3245e.name: Introduction to Computer Science II (CS102) v1

71fe0018-e56b-4c56-ba86-b5a68643d8f7.description: The course provides an introduction to the current physical understanding of our universe, from an examination of basic principles of physical law, their application to the behavior of objects, and the use of the scientific method in driving advances in this knowledge. Topics include introduction to physics; motion in a straight line; kinematics in two dimensions; dynamics; circular motion and gravity; work and energy; momentum and collisions; statics and torque; and angular momentum.
71fe0018-e56b-4c56-ba86-b5a68643d8f7.name: PHYS101: Introduction to Mechanics (SAYA-0031)

14335fe7-9acf-4e4d-a909-127d4a2e40d3.name: PHYS102: Introduction to Electromagnetism (v.2)

5d43b7b5-b875-42ab-9724-10c36fea5594.description: The course objective is to provide an examination of the major texts and figures in the history of political thought, including Plato, Machiavelli, and Rousseau. Topics of analysis include power, justice, rights, law, the polis modern political thought, liberal democracy and its critics, and other issues pertaining to governance.
5d43b7b5-b875-42ab-9724-10c36fea5594.name: POLSC201: Introduction to Western Political Thought (SAYA-0033)

badge_template_activities.title: The method of assessment includes an examination with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audiovisual materials, practical exercises, lecture, discussion, and computer based training.

1ca71f0c-3e81-4877-916c-afb7ba6f1533.description: The course objective is to examine major texts in Western political thought, where authors pose difficult questions about the political community, social order, and human nature. How do our views about human nature and history inform government design? We explore how Plato, Machiavelli, and Rousseau, responded and how these philosophers contributed to the broader conversation about human needs, goods, justice, democracy, and the ever-changing relationship between the citizen and the state.
1ca71f0c-3e81-4877-916c-afb7ba6f1533.name: POLSC201: Introduction to Western Political Thought (v.2)

d13ae989-9f2c-448c-b604-d63b2bf641ef.description: The course objective is to introduce communication principles, common communication practices, and a selection of theories to better understand the communication transactions that most people experience in everyday life.
d13ae989-9f2c-448c-b604-d63b2bf641ef.name: Principles of Human Communication (COMM001) v1

5644a83c-5d26-4661-9d9f-7c2c5e49b981.description: The course objective is to present software engineering concepts and principles in parallel with the software development life cycle, and to present software engineering as a body of knowledge. Students will master software engineering concepts, principles, and essential processes of the SDLC; and demonstrate that knowledge by creating UML artifacts for requirements gathering, analysis, and design phases using an object-oriented methodology.
5644a83c-5d26-4661-9d9f-7c2c5e49b981.name: Software Engineering (CS302) v1

c70ef13d-9378-4a20-acbc-4e72e0ed8f80.description: The course provides students with the understanding and appreciation of common biological topics: molecules and cells. Topics include an introduction to biology; basic chemistry; biological molecules; cells and cell membrane; enzymes, metabolism, and cellular respiration; photosynthesis; cellular reproduction; Mendelian Genetics and chromosomes; and gene expression.
c70ef13d-9378-4a20-acbc-4e72e0ed8f80.name: BIO101B: Introduction to Molecular and Cellular Biology (SAYA-0002)

581ba91e-8919-40f3-9a7c-4e59f870bd3b.description: The course objective is to introduce students to the fundamental principles of psychology and to the major subjects of psychological inquiry. This course is designed not only provide students with the tools necessary for the study of psychology, but to present a sampling of the major areas of psychology research.
581ba91e-8919-40f3-9a7c-4e59f870bd3b.name: Introduction to Psychology (PSYCH101) v1

3f5a323d-1c5d-468f-8fcf-f5445df9172b.description: The course objective is to introduce students to a range of basic sociological principles to develop their sociological imagination. The course examines the origins of sociology as a discipline and the major sociological theories and methods of research. Students explore such topics as sex and gender, deviance, and racism.
3f5a323d-1c5d-468f-8fcf-f5445df9172b.name: Introduction to Sociology (SOC101) v1

2437ed9b-149e-464d-8f7c-b47f48563cb9.name: COMM411: Public Relations (v.1)
